questions.question: How many subkeys are generated in the DES key generation process?

explanations.a: Incorrect. There are more than 8 subkeys generated in DES.
explanations.b: Incorrect. There are more than 10 subkeys generated in DES.
explanations.c: Correct. DES generates 16 subkeys for use in each of the 16 rounds of encryption.
explanations.d: Incorrect. There are not as many as 32 subkeys in DES; there are only 16.

questions.question: Which component of the DES key generation is responsible for selecting 48 out of 56 bits to create a subkey?

explanations.a: Incorrect. The initial permutation is involved in the encryption process, not key generation.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The expansion permutation is used in the encryption function to expand the data block.
explanations.c: Correct. The PC-2 compression permutation selects 48 out of 56 bits during subkey generation.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The straight permutation is part of the encryption function, not the key generation.

questions.question: Total number of left shifts across all DES rounds is:
DES produces 16 round keys. If you mistakenly do two left shifts in round 2 (instead of 1), how many round keys will become wrong?
In the DES algorithm, although the key size is 64 bits, only 48bits are used for the encryption procedure, the rest are parity bits.
